overview: Inspired by true events, "The Wave" is a gripping exploration of the human psyche and the dangers of groupthink. The play is set in a Transition Year classroom where a history teacher decides to teach his students about fascism and the dangers of totalitarianism. However, things quickly spiral out of control as the experiment takes on a life of its own and the students become increasingly radicalized.  With a talented cast of actors, "The Wave" promises to be a riveting theatrical experience. The play deftly explores complex themes of power, control, and the seductive nature of group dynamics.  "The Wave" is a timely and thought-provoking work that speaks to the current political climate and the dangers of extremism. It is a powerful reminder of the importance of critical thinking, individual agency, and the need to resist the pull of conformity.
title: The Wave
